channel.title: esp32 on Greg Herlein
channel.description: Recent content in esp32 on Greg Herlein

item.title: First Trials: ESP32-POE-EA Board from Olimex
item.description:
Tl/Dr: It’s on the network! But in my analysis, I fell victim to my own bias.

Picking up from last weekend, I play with the ESP32-POE-EA board from Olimex using the Espressif FreeRTOS ESP-IDF Framework.

item.title: Playing like it was summer (but with an ESP32)
item.description: Been awhile, head spinning, took some time to just play.

item.title: Playing with Tasmota - A Swimming Pool Story
item.description: Playing around with Tasmota - as the sensing core of an IoT-based swimming pool temperature control system.

item.title: Progress on ESP32 and FreeRTOS
item.description: Progress, but not where I want it to be. But it builds and installs the FreeRTOS AWS IoT demo.

item.title: Dabbling into ESP32 and FreeRTOS
item.description: Dipping a toe into the FreeRTOS ESP32 world.
